0.prompt:
Hello and welcome to the Cannonball 2T1 Choose your own adventure! Throughout the adventure you will be faced with many tough choices. Choose correctly and you shall be rewarded! Choose incorrectly and you shall….not be rewarded. Our story alludes to many facets of SkuleTM tradition and culture.

Want to learn more about the traditions, clubs, and people in the story? Simply click the bolded words to be taken to their website! Enjoy!

1.prompt: You awake to the sound of cannon fire. This troubles you at first but you quickly recall that it is to commemorate the ball that is occurring later this week, the Cannonball. You scratch your head and try to recall if you had purchased your ticket.

options.text: Ah yes, you did purchase the ticket off a local merchant
Alas! You have not yet purchased your ticket

2.prompt: Having already purchased your ticket, you meander over to Suds, the local tavern. Suds is known for playing the best bardcore music in the entire Kingdom, yet upon arrival, it is silent!

options.text: You immediately turn to leave. It was a little early for a drink anyways….
You take it upon yourself to liven the tavern up with your favourite Gregorian hymn

3.prompt: A wizard appears and says to you, “You fool! How could you not have purchased a ticket! Go purchase one now, lest I toss you into the thicket!”

options.text: You listen to the wizard and go purchase your ticket from cannonball.skule.ca
You ignore the wizard, how bad can the thicket be?

4.prompt:
The thicket indeed is very terrible. You wander around for ages but cannot seem to escape the dense shrubbery.

Please try again after you have purchased your ticket from cannonball.skule.ca/ticket!

5.prompt:
You start chanting the hymn of the Lady Godiva:
We are We are We are We are--
We are the engineers--
We can We can We can We can--
Demolish forty beers--
Drink rum Drink rum Drink rum Drink rum--
and come along with us for--
We don't give a damn for any damn man--
Who don't give a damn for us--

options.text: That sure was fun, but you better get going...it really is too early to be in a tavern
You don’t ever want this fun to stop! You take the lead into the next verse

6.prompt:
You continue on with the next verse of Godiva’s hymn:
Godiva was a lady who through Coventry did ride--
To show to all the villagers her __________

Oh no! You’ve all forgotten the next line! Everyone’s looking at you so expectantly….what was it?

options.text: fine and lily-white hide
kind and brilliant mind
fine and little behind

6_1.prompt: No, that’s not quite right….let's try again

options.text: Go back and guess again

7.prompt: Ah, thank goodness you remembered the rest of the line! Having sufficiently cheered yourself out for now, you decide it's finally time to face the day. You leave the tavern and see that the merchant across the way is selling some unusual goods.

options.text: You go checkout what they’re selling, it sure looks odd
You feel that you contributed to the local economy quite enough in the tavern. Best not do any more shopping today

8.prompt: You make it to the Engineering Stores and lean against the table of the merchant, as your ancestors have done for generations before you. The merchant says, “Welcome to Engineering Stores, what can I get ya?”

options.text: You inquire about the blue underpants that have been embroidered with gold thread
You ask for the local gossip (Engineering Stores in known throughout the Kingdom as having a wealth of knowledge)

9.prompt: You purchase the underpants and leave. As you leave, you accidentally drop the undergarment you just purchased. A strange feeling of deja vu sweeps over you...something about dropping….and this underwear….hmmm….

options.text: You return the underwear to the merchant….something about this underwear seems off….
Whatever it is, how bad can it be? You decide to keep the underwear

10.prompt: The merchant tells you they don’t have time for idle chat, so you leave empty handed.

options.text: Go back

11.prompt: You set off down the cobblestone path, not sure of which way to go.

options.text: You decide to visit your friend John at his turkey farm
You decide to wander around the Kingdom

12.prompt: You greet John and he tells you all about the library he’s been working on. You think this is rather odd. Turkeys and libraries really shouldn’t mix… John ignores your doubtful look and explains how the Lord and Lady of the land are very impressed with his library. They’ve bestowed upon him the honor of reading the sacred text that marks the beginning of Godiva Week. Unfortunately, John forgets where this text would be located! Is it:

options.text: Calculus for Scientists and Engineers
Fundamentals of Physics
The Bible

12_1.prompt: You search the book through several times, no sign of the sacred text...maybe it was in one of the other novels?

options.text: Go back and pick again

13.prompt: Ah yes, of course! The sacred text is in Calculus for Scientists and Engineers! John says to you, “Thanks! I’m sure we’ll find the text very easily, how long could this book be?”. To your dismay, this book has over 1000 pages! You flip to the table of contents, which section would contain the sacred text?

options.text: The “Functions” Section
The “Derivatives” Section
The “Differential Equations” Section
The “Integration” Section

13_1.prompt: Hmmm, the sacred text isn’t in there…….maybe you should try a different section?

options.text: Go back and pick again

14.prompt: Of course! The sacred text, being the fundamental theorem of calculus, would be in the Integration section! John thanks you for your help and starts practising. You decide to get out of there before you fall asleep…

options.text: Next

15.prompt: You set off down the path with your new underpants. You hear the blaring of a trumpet; here comes the Crown’s personal ensemble, the LGMB. The Leedur of the LGMB speaks: “By order of the Lord and Lady of the land, everyone is to be searched! Something sacred to Lord Blue and Gold has been stolen, and the thief is to be caught and punished!”

options.text: You stay where you are, you haven’t done anything wrong, you don’t have anything to hide
You start to get a bad feeling about the underwear you just purchased. Could these be Lord Blue and Gold's beloved underpants?

16.prompt: You are searched by the LGBM. They take the underwear you just purchased. The Leedur says to you: “These are Lord Blue and Golds sacred underpants! You will now be punished by means of auditory torture!”. The LGMB surrounds you and starts to play. You are being drummed upon, chanted at, and forced to listen while they play. It won’t end. They start telling jokes. You wish death would take you. Eventually, thankfully, you slip into unconsciousness….

options.text: You awaken to the abandoned street in the early hours of the morning. It seems that you have missed the entire Cannonball… Please try again

Bnad Leedur: “I don’t know, what do you call a cow in an earthquake?”

options.text: You: “I don’t know, you tell me!”
You: “A milkshake!”

options.text: Oh no

19.prompt: The whole Bnad erupts in laughter! You use this opportunity to escape. Phew, that was a close one.

options.text: You drop the underpants outside the local newspaper stand, deciding that the Toike editors can take the fall for the underpants debacle. They’re used to being in trouble with the Crown.

20.prompt: You’re on the run. You know it's a crime to keep Lord Blue and Gold’s underpants, yet you won’t give them up.

options.text: You decide to set off for a different Kingdom, perhaps the Kingdom of Ryerson will allow you to settle down

21.prompt: You make a pit stop at your home before going to the Cannonball to change and pick up some items that will help you in your duel against Lord Blue and Gold.

options.text: You grab your very realistic replica of the Cannon
You grab your replica sword

22.prompt:
You make a very grand entrance into the Cannonball, brandishing your replica of the Cannon. You declare that not only have you stolen Lord Blue and Golds sacred underpants, you have also stolen the Cannon!

As you finish your proclamation, you hear laughter coming from all around the room. Alas! The room is filled with the Cannon Guard, and the Chief Attiliator is sitting quite comfortably, holding the real cannon

options.text: You run away, feeling great shame. Maybe you should get something else…
You try to convince them that you indeed have the real cannon

options.text: Next

options.text: You think twice about battling the Toike editor, maybe there’s a different way you can get past them?

options.text: You feel bad for him, he doesn’t deserve this humiliation
